title.narrative: Help Make Santa's Visit to IBSF Kids a Reality!

description.narrative: Our annual Christmas party is coming up on December 11, 2020. This year has been particularly difficult for many of our students due to effects of Covid-19 & we wanted to help bring some holiday cheer to them. Having this Christmas party will allow our students to celebrate with each other, enjoy some refreshments & take home gift items. Your donation & support will be instrumental to making this a reality. Thank you for your continued support of IBSF. We wish you all lots of blessings.

mailing-address.narrative: 2 Lateef Jakande Ikoyi, Lagos N/A Nigeria

title.narrative: Covid-19: Supporting street children in Mumbai

description.narrative: This project will provide support and information to 600 street children and their families during the Covid-19 pandemic in Mumbai. Forced to survive in the streets, the pandemic and the lockdown have put them in a very vulnerable position. Making use of a mobile unit, called the "Smiling Bus", we will provide them with support, resources and information to help them dealing with this terrible situation.

mailing-address.narrative: C. Pelai 32, 2 Barcelona 08001 Spain

title.narrative: A Covid Xmas: Gift 150 Cancer & DV Survivors

description.narrative: Trapped in the Discomfort of Home! COVID-19 has destroyed countless lives & thrust millions into needless suffering. The Masses have lost their zeal for life & hope for tomorrow! This Xmas let's make a difference to remind us Daily that Together, We're Stronger Than any Obstacle! Working Together we provide Masks, Food, Supplies, Gifts & Support to Survivors and Thrivers! Proving that Social Distancing is Not Social Isolation! We Are in this Together & We Will Win!

organisation.narrative: True Help & Empowerment for Women & Aspiring Youth Foundation USA

mailing-address.narrative: 9203 Hwy 6 South, Suite #124-236 Houston, TX 77083 United States

description.narrative: Having to climb a tree for making a call or have enough internet signal to send a message, walk more than two hours to a hill or ride kilometers in a motorcycle to reach the nearest village and get three lines of phone signal that allows internet connection is what most rural youths and children must do during COVID-19 to access education, information, and opportunities. We aim to provide rural youths with a connectivity KIT with energy and internet access and essential IT equipment.#CloseTheGap

mailing-address.narrative: Carrera 109 # 131-23 Bogota 111131 Colombia

title.narrative: MAMA Kits for Expectant Mothers, Baringo, Kenya

description.narrative: This project will provide 100 covid-19 maternity kits equipped with surgical gloves, medicott sanitary towel, cotton wool, surgical blade, umbilical cord knot, disinfectant, gauze, baby wrapper, baby blanket, bibs, toiletry bag and face mask. The delivery kits will restore dignity of expectant mothers seeking services of unskilled traditional birth attendants. Proper equipment reduces chances of complicated birthing and infections.

mailing-address.narrative: P.o. Box 34130-00100 Royal Plaza, 5th Floor, Suite 502, Roysambu, Kamiti Rd, Off Thika Road Nairobi 00100 Kenya

title.narrative: Bright Christmas 2020 for children of Covid year.

description.narrative: A & V Rhythmic club bringing together young girls from diverse backgrounds and to make them feel included in the sport and community through Christmas party and Christmas gifts. Covid 19 has ripped though families and grounded UK economy. Lockdown has affected children's mental health, boredom, stress and loneliness is a reality for many kids in lockdown. Many children said that their club is very important for their wellbeing over the lockdown and have look forward to Xmas performance.

organisation.narrative: Friendship Society - A & V Rhythmic Club

mailing-address.narrative: Youth and Family centre 105 West Street Erith DA8 1AG United Kingdom

description.narrative: After eight months of Covid-19 restrictions, Orbis has recommenced sight-saving activities in Ethiopia. Trachoma is a bacterial infection of the eye which can cause irreversible blindness. Unfortunately trachoma affects many people in impoverished regions of Ethiopia. However, there is an antibiotic, costing just 12 cent, that treats and prevents the disease. Orbis aims to distribute the antibiotic to 150,000 people in the Dita and Oyida regions of Southern Ethiopia before the end of this year.

mailing-address.narrative: 20-21 St Patrick's Road Dalkey Dublin,, Dublin A96 DV76 Ireland

title.narrative: Support Women in Japan Experiencing Domestic Abuse

description.narrative: Domestic violence has skyrocketed since the onset of COVID-19, as more women have needed to stay home. It is crucial that individuals know they can reach out to TELL and that there will be someone to listen, help them access shelters and develop safety plans if necessary. Studies have shown that suicide can be prevented when a person has someone who will listen to them. By supporting this project, you will help to fund the training of 60 crisis lifeline support workers over the next year.

mailing-address.narrative: Wesley Center 2F 6-10-11 Minami-Aoyama Minato-ku 107-0062 Japan

description.narrative: Distributing Food Supplies for Families in need who affected by Covid-19 Pandemic. Due to this pandemic, Bali is closed for International tourism and many people struggling to provide for their families and there are many unemployment in Bali. Hotels are closed, restaurant empty, Tourist object quiet. With food supplies we will be able to help the people surviving day by day.

mailing-address.narrative: Jalan Pura Masuka #77 Br. Wanagiri, Ungasan, Kuta Selatan Badung, Bali 80361 Indonesia

description.narrative: In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, PCI Media has launched Team Survive to tackle crisis and emergency communication, based on our Ebola work in West Africa in 2015. We partner with communities to produce content that communicates vital information, empowering people to make informed decisions in emergency situations. Our COVID-19 response educates about contact tracing and vaccination, impacts on women and girls, food security, and more. Your support helps us create more media for change.

mailing-address.narrative: 26 Broadway Suite 934 New York, New York 10004 United States

title.narrative: Support for Youth Mental Health during COVID

description.narrative: The mental health of young people needs more support than ever before with the ongoing environment brought on by COVID-19. This project aims to train 60 crisis lifeline support workers over the next 12 months, to provide more support during the 2021 Olympics, and to ensure that awareness of these resources are reaching the youth that need help, in a medium that works for them. Be a part of saving lives and making the future possible for struggling youth in Japan.

mailing-address.narrative: Wesley Center 2F 6-10-11 Minami-Aoyama Minato-ku 107-0062 Japan

title.narrative: Secure food safety for 100 families amidst drought

description.narrative: Besides COVID-19 shutting down alternative income from tourism, Andean llama farmers are now facing the worse drought since 2002. This year they have survived with their crop reserves from last year. But the lack of rain and freezings have ruined this year's production. With your donation you will provide non perishable products so families can get through these challenging months. Andean llama farmers work to protect fragile mountain ecosystems and water resources, help us help them!

mailing-address.narrative: PISTA URUBAMBA OLLANTAYTAMBO NRO. L2 HUINCHO URUBAMBA 08660 Peru

title.narrative: Support the Projects of Over 65 Honduran Leaders!

description.narrative: The Solidarity Project is a 501(c)3 organization working with a network of Honduran Community Leaders in seven partner communities to execute development projects of the communities' choice through our Community Micro-grant program, Mesa Comunitaria. With the impact of Covid-19 and Hurricane Eta & Iota, many projects will support rebuilding and expansion of damaged water systems, reconstruction of a collapsed bridge and funds will support our Covid-19 response work in health and food security.

mailing-address.narrative: 805 Burns Street Missoula, MT 59802 United States

title.narrative: Bike Library for 300 children in 6 communities

description.narrative: This Project will run a bicycle library in 6 low income communities of Lahore, Pakistan and will provide a rich supply of books to 300 children on average. This is an action to bring smiles to children stuck at home in times of covid; battling mental stress, uncertainty, school closure and loss in income of their parents. This critical literacy support service will not just bring activity based learning but will also act as psycho-social therapy for these traumatized children.

mailing-address.narrative: 3B, GULBERG II, MAIN MARKET Lahore, Punjab 54660 Pakistan

title.narrative: Help a Special Needs School Adapt to COVID Context

description.narrative: COVID-19 has had a devastating effect on public education in Ecuador, especially for children & teens with special learning needs. Classes have been online since 03/2020, but students will gradually begin returning to the classroom in 02/2021. The Ayni Ecuador Foundation is partnering with the only special needs school in Otavalo to bring vital infrastructure, hygiene supplies and training necessary to successfully and safely integrate these special students into this blended learning structure.

mailing-address.narrative: Ricaurte 346 Salinas Otavalo, Imbabura 100450 Ecuador

description.narrative: We are building and installing handwashing stations as well as training others as well as educating the people on COVID 19 and the importance of handwashing throughout Uganda. We have also created a tutorial program to help the children continue their studies while the schools are closed. And our newest project is helping the elderly by providing food/medical care/basic service around their farms and home.

mailing-address.narrative: 7 S Stolp Ave Aurora, IL 60506 United States

title.narrative: More Power for the Community Center

description.narrative: With the national emergency of COVID-19, the community center has expanded with an industrial kitchen, 3 freezers and two refrigerators to feed the entire community. The community does not have the necessary infrastructure, thats why the community center had to be resilient and 100% off grid in solar energy, it has two cisterns and its rainwater collection system. With this new worl wide emergency we have increase our energy consumption and are in the need to expand our energy storage.

mailing-address.narrative: 75 Calle Junin Cond. Puerta del Sol Apt. 807 San Juan, PR 00926 Puerto Rico

title.narrative: Bahamas Emergency Fire and Ambulance Services

description.narrative: Eleuthera Emergency Partners is a volunteer-run organisation that provides communities with fire and medical assistance. With no hospital and no government-run emergency programme, this network provides essential community services. With increased demand due to COVID-19, even more lives are saved by this vital link in medical evacuations. Donations help cover the costs of new vehicles, basic operating costs, token stipends for the cadre of dedicated volunteers, training and life-saving equipment

mailing-address.narrative: 6 Carolina Lane Beaufort, SC 29907 United States

description.narrative: We will provide food comprising rice, noodles, meat, fish, milk, eggs, vegetables among others to 600 very poor families affected by disasters, climate change and the Coronavirus pandemic with the food supply to last until 2 months in order for the families to experience the contentment and happiness of having adequate supply of food in their homes.

organisation.narrative: Asset-Based Community Development with Equity Foundation

mailing-address.narrative: Turno, Dipolog City Zamboanga del Norte Dipolog City 7100 Philippines

description.narrative: In India's West Bengal state, 1-2 elephants die each year from accidental or deliberate electrocutions. But by November 2020 up to 10 elephants had been electrocuted. While some cases were caused by sagging wires, deliberate electrocutions have been surging during COVID lockdown, with farmers protecting their crops using illegal electrical fences. This pilot, based in Jalpaiguri district, aims to thwart elephant electrocution by using friendly fences and community outreach to create awareness.

mailing-address.narrative: 3415 South Sepulveda Blvd., Suite 1100 Los Angeles, CA 90034 United States

description.narrative: We will provide education, small livelihoods, emergency, health and sanitation support to 400 disadvantaged youth in order to provide them with head-start in life enabling them to face a bright future. This assumes very great significance with local communities suffering from low economic activities due to the Coronavirus pandemic.

organisation.narrative: Water, Agroforestry, Nutrition and Development Foundation

mailing-address.narrative: Libertad Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental 9021 Philippines

title.narrative: Everyday Gifts: Food, Seeds and Mosquito Nets

description.narrative: We will provide food, vegetable seeds and mosquito nets to 1,200 very poor villagers who lacked this basic amenities for their daily needs. The supply of food is urgent during this time when the Coronavirus pandemic is spreading even in remote areas. This is coupled with changing climate and the virulence of natural disasters. Vegetable seeds will be utilized to improve food security and mosquito nets will be to ward off mosquito-borne diseases.

organisation.narrative: Association of Locally Empowered Youth - Northern Mindanao

mailing-address.narrative: Libertad, Misamis Oriental Cagayan de Oro 9021 Philippines

title.narrative: Better lives for 500 families in Ramdhuni, Nepal

description.narrative: Between January and June 2021, ETC will support marginalized families in Ramdhuni Municipality, Sunsari District, Nepal. Building on decades of success in Nepal, we'll work in partnership with village residents and local leaders to address the most pressing problems: food insecurity, lack of income generating opportunities, lack of resources in schools, and COVID prevention. All activities will be undertaken with due precautions for the safety of our staff and program participants alike.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 414 Ithaca, NY 14851 United States

title.narrative: The EMPOWER Project for Education through WASH

description.narrative: With Ebola aftermaths and recently the COVID-19 crisis, Sierra Leone continues to be saddled by huge challenges of addressing past and current recovery shocks. The odds have not been in the favor of majority of children, more so girls hoping to complete their education. Access to conducive learning spaces; basic toilets and water constitutes a daily nightmare in addition to poor hygiene conditions. With this project, we hope to rewrite these access gaps in favour of particularly the girl child.

mailing-address.narrative: 5 Bailey Street Brookfields Freetown, Western Urban 00232 Sierra Leone

title.narrative: Help Bring Christmas to Street Families amid COVID

description.narrative: This project will bring Christmas to women, babies and children living on the streets of Nairobi. We will supply masks, diapers, sanitary pads, blankets, new underwear and food to 100-200 people living in the streets on Christmas Day!

mailing-address.narrative: #775 Highway 23 South Revelstoke, BC V0E 2S0 Canada

title.narrative: Girls Education for Brighter Futures Post-COVID-19

description.narrative: For 100 years, Graduate Women International has developed, coordinated and operated impactful global education, gender equality and empowering projects for women and girls around the world. Our vision is for 100% of girls and women in the world to achieve quality education beyond primary school to reach their highest potentials. The advocacy work and micro-projects held throughout the world remove the sociocultural, gender-related, and economic barriers girls face towards education endeavours.

organisation.narrative: Graduate Women International (GWI), (formerly International Federation of University Women)

mailing-address.narrative: Chemin du Grand Montfleury, 48 Versoix 1290 Switzerland

description.narrative: Hurricane Iota (Category 5 storm) hit Central America in November, bringing catastrophic winds and a life-threatening storm surge. Iota's arrival comes as the region is still recovering from Hurricane Eta. The emergency in the face of storms and the global context of the Covid-19 pandemic increases the risk of the most vulnerable families. Habitat Guatemala is responding with hygiene kits, reconstruction kits, and home reparation and reconstruction.

organisation.narrative: Fundacion Habitat para la Humanidad Guatemala

mailing-address.narrative: Av. Las Americas 9-50, Zona 3 Edificio SuperCom Delco, 3er. Nivel, Oficina No. 3 Quetzaltenango 09001 Guatemala

title.narrative: Provide HIV services to 13,000 Vulnerable Ugandans

description.narrative: The COVID-19 pandemic has increased the poverty level of many Ugandans including our clients and negatively affected HIV/AIDS and Sexual Reproductive Health and Rights services and all other medical services. AIDS is not over yet! This project will enable 13,000 clients in Uganda access HIV prevention, care, treatment and support that has now been threatened by COVID 19 and contribute the HIV epidemic control.

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 5, U.N. Rise First Close, Kisugu - Namuwongo P.O. Box 37374 Kampala Uganda

title.narrative: Ruadt Annapoorna midday meal programme for elderly

description.narrative: Annapoorna Midday meal for the elders BY RUADT The coronavirus pandemic and poverty go hand in hand. The lockdown has seen many people striving hard to live and survive. And for a joint family, which typically involves five to six members of three generations, the lack of regular work has caused severe problems. it is a burden. This unforeseen time is testing the bond and strength of the family and for many, it is 'joint' in name only. Because of poverty, the elders of the family are increasingl

mailing-address.narrative: RUADT B.Dharmathupatti, Melachokkanathapuram (PO) Bodinayakanur 625 582 India

title.narrative: Disaster Relief: Feeding the Hungry in Honduras

description.narrative: Missoula Medical Aid is supporting a Save the Children Honduras project to feed hungry families impoverished by the Covid 19 pandemic, and Hurricanes Eta and Iota. This project helps small farmers get supplies to plant a crop of basic grains this year, and gives groups of rural women training and seed money to start businesses making bread or tortillas. It also provides oral hygiene kits, and instruction, to children.

mailing-address.narrative: Po Box 903 Missoula, MT 59806 United States

title.narrative: Urgent COVID-19 support to 50 children in Yemen

description.narrative: The project targeting 50 impoverished orphan youth who are vulnerable to abuse, neglect, & exploitation by Criminals & extremists. providing holistic care in the areas of,education, food, legal protection, medical & psychosocial services to orphans & vulnerable kids.Our program reaches 300 youth providing the only meal most will eat for the day, & our scholarship program allows youth (boys & girls) opportunity to attend school who otherwise wouldn't be able to attend.We offer hope beyond poverty

mailing-address.narrative: Amman st.sixty road Sana'a Sana'a, Sana'a +967 Yemen

description.narrative: Organ transplantation is a gift of life. A second chance to live made possible by an organ donor. Unfortunately, transplanted patients are a high-risk population for COVID-19. But thanks to technology, it is possible to help optimize the treatment of these patients and thus, save them from losing the transplant and/or losing their life.

mailing-address.narrative: Parc Cientific de Barcelona C/Baldiri Reixac, 4-8 Torre I. Planta 8 Barcelona 08028 Spain

title.narrative: PROVIDE 66 ADOLESCENT MOTHERS WITH MILKING COWS

description.narrative: This project will provide adolescent women and their children with milking cows. Many unwed mothers who face unplanned pregnancies are subject to abuse, neglect and malnutrition for themselves and their child. COVID has increased this. Cows provide a sustainable income, create self-sufficiency for the single mother, and combat nutrient deficiencies for the child. This leads to a healthy life for both mother and child due to sustained income which provides health care and education opportunities

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 4678 Kigali, Kigali NA Rwanda

title.narrative: Plant Trees in Monk and Community Forests

description.narrative: Peace Bridges will partner with Buddhist monks, a local forest group, and Christian pastors to organize tree plantings in their villages and community forests. This is a unique opportunity for Cambodians of all faiths and backgrounds to cooperate and restore areas that have been deforested. The goals of this project are to plant 5,000 native trees, engage and educate youth and faith groups about the environment, and mitigate the global threat of climate change. Timeline contingent on COVID-19.

mailing-address.narrative: #73 Street 608 Toul Kork Phnom Penh 12152 Cambodia

title.narrative: Urgent aid for Abdo& his family for COVID in Yemen

description.narrative: As a black man living in the most underserved neighborhood in Yemen, Abdo works as a janitor. He exposes himself to the most hazardous conditions and deals with infected wastes in order to offer nourishment and shelter for his 14 children, whereas federal medical aid is inattentive. Yet, 4 children died consequently from Cholera owing to the absence of favorable living conditions. Abdo needs heroes like you are to help his 10 children survive COVID global pandemic and educate his children.

mailing-address.narrative: Amman st.sixty road Sana'a Sana'a, Sana'a +967 Yemen

title.narrative: COVID-19 Relief Fund for Families in Ghana

description.narrative: This COVID-19 relief project will provide crisis management support to our families by ensuring that basic necessities such as food and water are provided. Although GEC typically works to provide school tuition support and mentoring to students and families in Ghana, we have had to shift our priorities to help students and parents make it through the pandemic safely until schools reopen.

mailing-address.narrative: 10540 Remmick Ridge Rd Parker, CO 80134 United States

title.narrative: Art, Science, & English For Gaza Kids During COVID

description.narrative: Most schools went online across the world during the COVID. However, many children in Palestine cannot do the same due to lack of equipment and finances. You can help three Palestinian teachers in Gaza and the West Bank teach Arts, English, and Science to young children. This pilot project is raising funds to cover the teachers' salaries, study materials, masks and hand sanitizers to ensure education for the children who are most in need while keeping them safe.

mailing-address.narrative: 50 Woodside Road Ste. 627 Redwood City, CA 94061 United States

description.narrative: Covid-19's impact on the economy of Haiti was staggering. OUR ACTION PLAN to impact 1000s of residents: Invest in agriculture by providing seeds,training related to climate change & land/crop management;Invest in economic growth by supporting Local Mutuelles Solidarites (community cooperative financing platforms with affordable interest rates);Develop with women's organizations a soap making small business initiative; Work with local universities such as L'Universite de Jeremie & local students.

organisation.narrative: Economic Stimulus Projects for Work and Action- ESPWA

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 391494 Cambridge, MA 02139 United States

title.narrative: COVID-19 Education and Training for Myanmar

description.narrative: COVID-19 continues to have a huge impact on the livelihood and health status of people in Myanmar. Many people in this community lack access to proper education and training regarding COVID-19. Our training is designed to address health and safety in the context of COVID-19. The courses are developed and delivered in collaboration with Eastern Michigan University, Global Health Services Network, and the American Nursing Institute in Myanmar.

mailing-address.narrative: 23917 Cass Avenue, Suite B Farmington, MI 48835 United States

title.narrative: Provide Counseling & Support to Sexually Abused

description.narrative: The COVID-19 crisis has highlighted another global epidemic: child sexual abuse and online exploitation. With both offenders and children at home using the internet, casework has been soaring. The impact of these crimes against children is impossible to overstate. Depression and suicide are common and on the rise. This project will provide trauma-informed counseling, as well as other victim support such as home visits and family therapy through the Child Advocacy Center in Chiang Mai, Thailand.

mailing-address.narrative: 397/2 Moo 7 T. Mae Hia Muang, Chiang Mai 50100 Thailand

description.narrative: Domestic abuse of any sort is a major problem around the world, but in countries like Zimbabwe, the major gender inequality and financial dependency all contribute to the increasingly high statistics of violence within homes. This abuse is generally targeted at the woman and has heightened since COVID, which is why we aim to provide a safe space for women to reach out as well as therapy and assistance to help them rebuild their lives.

mailing-address.narrative: International House 12 Constance Street London, London E16 2DQ United Kingdom

title.narrative: The Wisdom Center: Bridging a Generational Gap

description.narrative: Health Nest Uganda, a nonprofit organization and member of the HelpAge Global Network, has found that older people in the community, particularly during COVID-19, can experience loneliness while facing deepening poverty and health issues. Younger people have little opportunity or space to engage with older people. To bridge this generational gap, Health Nest Uganda aims to create a Wisdom Center, which will provide a space for both groups to share their knowledge with one another.

mailing-address.narrative: 1730 M St. Nw Suite 1000 Washington, DC 20036 United States

description.narrative: The coronavirus crisis means the near total loss of income for wildlife conservation NGO Biosphere Expeditions. Please help us survive the crisis by providing funding that will help us to make it through 2021. Any donation, large or small, will help. Please give generously to help us survive!

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 917750 Longwood, FL 32791 United States

title.narrative: Educate Girls in Zambia on Gender Equity

description.narrative: The primary objectives of the project are to address the issue of girls' education, and address the root causes that hinder their full participation and attendance, which have also been exacerbated as a result of COVID- 19. This will be done through school sessions and safe counselling groups, which will provide awareness and sensitize the students (including teenage boys) on the benefits of gender equity. The focus of the intervention will be to reduce the number of out of school girls.

mailing-address.narrative: PO BOX 37352 Lusaka 10101 Zambia

description.narrative: We have been deeply involved in sustaining North and South Carolinians with food, hygiene and PPE needs for six months. We reallocated our entire 2020 budget to doing so as well as what we currently have remaining. Our team has been also focused on making sure our elderly military veteran population (of over 750,000), as well as our civilian elderly, can survive this time in history, as they are often forgotten about.

organisation.narrative: US Military Veterans Hall of Fame

mailing-address.narrative: 4522 Carnfeld LN Charlotte, NC 28215 United States

title.narrative: Nutritious Foods for Sierra Leone Students

description.narrative: Over 400 students, (ages 5-14) who attend Diamond Child School (est. 2005) are at risk of dropping out if they aren't guaranteed a balanced meal daily; for most, the only nutritious meal received in any given week. A healthy diet that includes vegetables and fruit boosts the immune system of these vulnerable "Diamonds", especially during this lingering Covid-19 pandemic. A nutritious meal is key to helping students listen, focus, learn and stay healthy, while staying in school!

mailing-address.narrative: 138 Winding Brook Lane #7 A Califon, NJ 07830 United States

title.narrative: Continue GL's Legacy- All Funds Matched to $15k!

description.narrative: ALL FUNDS MATCHED up to $15k by an anonymous local foundation. After 24 years of empowering students & serving our local & international communities, GL was forced to pause operations due to COVID. GL is asking for financial support to continue to serve the Northern Colorado community. GL has taken significant measures to cut costs to stay afloat through these difficult times (salaries, rent, insurance, etc...). Help GL leap into the new year stronger than ever. Donate today & SHARE THIS LINK!

mailing-address.narrative: 405 E Prospect Rd. Suite 4 Fort Collins, CO 80525 United States

title.narrative: Empowering female newcomers with digital skills

description.narrative: She Matters' Lotus Flower Programme (LFP) provides career readiness training, mentorship and job placement opportunities for female newcomers in the Netherlands. In 2020, the LFP has been disrupted by COVID-19. We aim to provide online LFPs, allowing women across the country to gain both digital and soft skills needed for submitting online applications. Having an adequately-paid job will transform our participants' lives and have an immediate positive impact on them and their communities.

mailing-address.narrative: Stationsplein 45 4th Floor Rotterdam 3013AK Netherlands

title.narrative: Provide COVID Relief for Families in Rural India.

description.narrative: The COVID-19 crisis has devastated lives across the globe -- and has been especially brutal for the poor in rural Rajasthan, India. People from this arid region often migrate to distant cities to find work in order to support their families. The lockdown due to COVID-19 this past spring forced these migrant workers to return home. They have little food or money, and no work. The Barefoot College Tilonia has responded by organizing relief efforts in these rural communities.

mailing-address.narrative: 134 Lincoln Place No 2 Brooklyn, NY 11217 United States

title.narrative: Online education for 1250 low-income kids COVID-19

description.narrative: Mexico is the second country that after the pandemic will have the highest school dropouts between the ages of 6 and 17, approximately 628,000 students, according to IDB calculations. With HOMEWORK we want to give teachers tools to continue teaching online classes, such as computers, chairs and internet. With this we can ensure that thousands of children can continue in school despite the pandemic.

mailing-address.narrative: Galileo 317, Polanco IV Sección Ciudad de Mexico, Ciudad de Mexico 11550 Mexico

title.narrative: Feed 1500 Households a Month in Ramadan in Ghana

description.narrative: Ramadan Feed Project is an initiative under Achievers Ghana to help raise funds to feed (Iftar) up to 1500 poor and deprived households in slum communities of Ghana who affected by the economic effect of COVID-19 pandemic due to lockdown which has derailed their business ventures. These individuals finds it difficult to feed themselves and their families. The funds raised will be used to purchase raw foodstuffs which can last for 29 or 30 days during the period of the month of Ramadan.

mailing-address.narrative: 1st Link Off Kanda Highway Maamobi Kawukudi Accra, Greater Accra 233 Ghana

title.narrative: Together promoting leaders who transform education

description.narrative: La educacion la ninez estan pasando por una crisis nunca antes vista. En una busqueda de apoyar a nuestros ninos, SER y Ensena por Mexico nos hemos aliado para seguir lideres y agentes de cambio que puedan ofrecer una educacion de calidad. SER & Ensena por Mexico come together to support the promotion of leaders for the educational system. The COVID-19 pandemic elevated an already existing crisis in the education sector and it is time to create alliances.

mailing-address.narrative: Hamburgo 14-PB Col. Juarez. Del. Cuauhtemoc Mexico City, Mexico City 06600 Mexico

title.narrative: Save the teachers from COVID-19 Pandemic set-back.

description.narrative: This campaign is up to supporting GOFA to be able to get out from the set back caused by COVID-19. Most of our programs were put on hold because of the pandemic but the most affected one is formal education program where we have a school project and now we are looking for support to be able to pay staff salaries, staff accommodation, feeding and other facilitations.

mailing-address.narrative: Mukono Uganda Kampala, Uganda 844 Uganda

description.narrative: Along with Project Tres, we support 15 women who are the mothers of our "babies" at the Hai Center. With our partnership, these women became artisans and nowadays the "Mamas company" plays an important role in their lives: they depend on it to feed their families and pay the rent for their homes. Strengthening our women through emotional and financial support directly impacts their lives and, consequently, their families, and the community around them.

mailing-address.narrative: Kabiria Road Nairobi 00101 Kenya

title.narrative: COVID19 Awareness & Safety Kit for Kenyan Children

description.narrative: Kenya continues to see a rise in COVID-19 infections and fatalities daily. With children going back to school, it has become urgent to find ways to reduce the spread of the virus, especially for those in marginalized areas. This project will create an Awareness and Safety campaign to teach on preventing the virus and teach Kenyan children, aged 5-12 years. Each child will receive an Awareness and Safety kit which will include an educational book, a box of crayons, a face mask, and a bar of soap.

mailing-address.narrative: Pinetree Plaza, Kaburu Drive Off Ngong Rd. Nairobi, Nairobi 00100 Kenya

title.narrative: Pregnancy Prevention for 200+ Teenagers in Zambia

description.narrative: In Kafue, Zambia, the challenges adolescent girls and young women face to access reproductive and menstrual health services have been exacerbated by COVID-19. Teenage pregnancies and STIs are on the rise. AEP will enhance its sexual, reproductive, and menstrual health services for its 200+ young women to include: weekly health text messages; monthly access to pregnancy and STI testing; access to monthly consultation and distribution of contraceptives; and access to reusable menstrual products.

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 6 Wayne, PA 19087 United States

description.narrative: At least 50 women each month will learn tailoring and how to run a small tailoring business. The project targets out-of-school girls, street girls, orphans and adolescent mothers aged between 15 and 35 years. Due to COVID-19, these groups have seriously affected. There are particularly vulnerable to violence, substance abuse, prostitution, HIV/AIDS, and poverty due to their social status. A reliable source of income has the power to transform their lives and the lives of their families.

organisation.narrative: RWANDAN YOUTH DEVELOPMENT AND VOLUNTARY ORGANIZATION

mailing-address.narrative: RWANDA RULINDO DISTRICT RULINDO CITY, NORTHER PROVINCE - Rwanda

title.narrative: Covid Aid- provide food for vulnerable adolescents

description.narrative: This project will help 35 young young people who had to leave the institutional shelter when they recently turned 18 years old. They don't have strong family ties or any government support. Due to the strong coronavirus sanitary, social and economic crisis in Brazil, they lost their jobs and need help to cope with this very difficult time. Your donation will provide food and internet access (to help them search for jobs and free professional training courses) for 12 months.

mailing-address.narrative: Rua Pedro Ortiz, 114 Sumarezinho, Sao Paulo 05440010 Brazil

title.narrative: Educate 150 Orphans and vulnerable girls in Uganda

description.narrative: While it is true everyone has struggled with the unprecedented impact of the Covid pandemic, it has had a more devastating impact on the girl child. As the government of Uganda plans to reopen schools after 1 year, many of the girls may not be able to resume school because they lack uniform, books, fees. FOWAC plans to dedicate International Women's Week to create hope in 150 Orphans and Vulnerable Girls in Kitgum to return to school decently, by providing them with basic scholastic needs.

organisation.narrative: Foundation for Women Affected by Conflicts (FOWAC)

title.narrative: Support Yemeni Children's Education in Rural Areas

description.narrative: This project will provide children with 350 school kits at Al-Fath school in Al-Qanawis district - Al-Hodeida city - Yemen. The kits will contain the most needed stationary for students. Due to the current conflict in Yemen, teachers has not received their salaries since 2015. Therefore, the project is also designed to provide 7 teachers with monthly salary of 50$ for 8 months. Moreover, personal protection equipment will be distributed to take the necessary measures against COVID-19 pandemic.

mailing-address.narrative: Political Area -60-Sanna Aden Khormaksar Sanaa, Sanaa 00967 Yemen

title.narrative: Protecting girls in Cambodia during COVID-19

description.narrative: We do whatever it takes to protect adolescent girls from trafficking and exploitation, but the recent outbreak of COVID-19 in Cambodia is jeopardising that freedom. The majority of our girls are in the most restrictive red zone, where food is scarce and markets are closed, so are distributing essential food relief to girls and their families so they can continue building a future post COVID.

mailing-address.narrative: 6/39 Robey Street Maroubra 2035 Australia

description.narrative: We are hosting a Scholarship Drive for 2021! Covid-19 has affected families. Escuela Adelante gives away an average of $26.84 per month per scholarship student. With 56 scholarship students, we give away $18,036.48 each year. We have a project to fund tuition for all 56 children 12 months long. All year long, Global Giving is matching one-time 100% on all NEW recurring donations. We need new yearly recurring donors until we reach our goal of $18k! All one time donations are of course welcome!

mailing-address.narrative: 5220 44TH Ave Sw Seattle, WA 98136 United States

description.narrative: This project will provide clean drinkable water to an impoverished community by enabling us to build an underground concrete water tank, collect rain water in this tank, purify the water and use it to run our Maid Strong and Health Care projects and pipe the water for community's usage. Access to water will improve hygiene, especially in this COVID time. Not having to buy water will ease financial burden on poor parents who traffic their adolescent girls as housemaids in the face of hardship.

mailing-address.narrative: 5 Inwelle Avenue Amorji Nike, Enugu 400103 Nigeria

description.narrative: Every March we host "Bowling for Burros" to raise much-needed funds to care for our resident burros. As a result of COVID-19 restrictions we will not be hosting Bowling for Burros in 2021. So instead of bowling for burros, we are inviting you to become a Burro Buddy. By becoming a Burro Buddy, you are helping us cover the on-going cost of providing life-long care for our burros.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 19131 San Diego, CA 92159 United States

description.narrative: COVID-19 and seasonal drought is causing severe food shortages across communities in southern Madagascar, leaving 1.5 million people unable to find enough food to eat, exacerbated by high levels of poverty. During this six-month intervention, SEED will provide emergency food distribution to communities and fund emergency transportation to hospital. SEED will work collaboratively within the healthcare system to improve the identification and treatment of children suffering with malnutrition.

mailing-address.narrative: Studio 7 1a Beethoven Street London, London W10 4LG United Kingdom

description.narrative: The project will deliver 2000 menstrual kits to girls in Eastern and Northern Uganda. One kit contains 3 regular size pads + 1 maxi pad + 1 storage bag + 1 booklet with information on menstruation. They can be reused for upto 4 years that is 100 washes. We relieve girls of the economic burdens caused by having to take care of their menstrual hygiene care during the COVID-19 pandemic by offering a more sustainable method. We would like also to help dispel myths and taboos about menstruation.

mailing-address.narrative: Kyambogo Kampala 1 Uganda

title.narrative: Keep 300 schools in rural Kenya safe from COVID-19

description.narrative: Children do not have access to basic handwashing facilities in school like clean, running water and soap. How can they be protected from COVID-19 transmission when schools don't have these basics? This project supports 300 schools across Kericho county to create a clean, safe environment for children with rain water harvesting, handwashing stations, improved toilets, hygiene education and teacher training. Over 104,000 boys and girls will stay healthy and stay in school.

mailing-address.narrative: 4 The Crescent, Millroad Midleton, Cork P25H302 Ireland

In Uganda, all schools were closed in March 2020 as part of total lockdown due to COVID-19 pandemic. This affected 17 million learners countrywide. description.narrative: KOSHISH provides short-term emergency residential psychosocial support to marginalized women who are locked, caged, chained, homeless, or abandoned in street even during COVID-19 pandemic . On average, at a time 30 women reside in quarantine center &therapeutic safe house of KOSHISH. The staff maintains their hygiene & cleanliness, gives fresh set of clothes every day, and changes bed-sheets from time-to-time. With availability of a washing machine, it would be effective to maintain cleanliness.

A bi-lingual model of Mexican Sign Language and written Spanish ensure that the students can thrive in an inclusive environment where they learn and progress within a community of their peers. Due to Covid-19 the school has pivoted to on-line virtual learning, opening up a broader landscape of opportunities, some newly discovered.

title.narrative: Help 195 Fijians Access Food & Education Safely!

description.narrative: This project will build a shoreline shelter, stairs with railings, and a dock for the 195 people of Wainidova, a tiny village located on the bank of the formidable Navua River (Fiji's longest), allowing them to access food, education, and healthcare in a safe way. COVID-19 hit Fiji's tourism hard- the largest export, and it has exacerbated the poverty in the village. The villagers have the choice to decide between using money to update the decaying river transport OR to feed their families.

title.narrative: Empower LBTQ women, empower the Caribbean

description.narrative: Globally women experience more violence, sexual harassment and assault. lesbian, bisexual, transgender and queer women even more so. COVID-19 has worsened the situation of LBTQ women criminalised in the Caribbean. Donate any amount to support our Caribbean Women & Sexual Diversity Conference (CWSDC) a space now even more important for women to learn to advocate for themselves and others and to build networks of support. Help protect all women by empowering LBTQ women. Donate today!

description.narrative: We will provide nutritious food and basic supplies to starving girls in 5 villages with 95% of the households belong to the poorest of the poor. description.narrative: Like most Palestinians across the West Bank and Gaza Strip, residents of Aida Refugee Camp in Bethlehem are spending Ramadan at home uncertain about their future. The deterioration of the economic condition due to COVID-19 has effected refugee families disproportionately, especially those with disabled children and those who live off a daily wage. Our Ramadan Food Bank campaign aims to distribute 500 food boxes to support these families during Ramadan and beyond.

title.narrative: Provide Urgent Covid-19 Relief for 3,000 UK Youth

description.narrative: This project will provide urgent support for 3,000 young people in the UK affected by Covid-19, and the subsequent issues that have emerged in their lives and communities. Our transformational programme harnesses the powerful near-peer experience that takes place between university students aged 18-24 and young people aged 13-16. University students will receive training to deliver online interactive wellbeing workshops, that build resilience and empower young people to make positive change.

description.narrative: Millions of children & youth in Afghanistan need to be hopeful, joyful, positive, inspired & make a bright future. The war, poverty & coronavirus are imposing increasing depression & hopelessness. MMCC for 19 years has been the major source of fun, creating peaceful culture & capacity-building children & youth. Because of the pandemic, we have lost a big part of our donor support at this crucial time. Join us in supporting our NGO & give a unique chance to the children and youth of Afghanistan.

mailing-address.narrative: Birkevej 19 Hundested, Hundested 3390 Denmark

description.narrative: Join our journey in expressing solidarity with the people of Lebanon who are enduring desperate conditions caused by the national financial crisis, the devastating explosion in Beirut on 4 August and the COVID-19 pandemic. Motivated by compassion, the project is people-focused and supports humanitarian aid for those who are struggling, especially the most vulnerable in society. The project focuses on the human dignity of all, and on fostering sustainable and inclusive social cohesion.

So far, we have assisted over 9,600 people with a wide range of concerns, from psychological help, to moral support, personal assitance, and other subjects.

The collaboration and communication between the change-makers and problem-solving agents on the Favela are unprecedented and allow the solution to come faster and more effectively to the most vulnerable families, especially in emergencies like the COVID-19 pandemic.

description.narrative: This project will enable more than 50 Manikaji school-age children to continue getting quality, relevant and inclusive education now that our 2020 donor cannot continue funding since his 3 Bali hotels closed due to COVID-19 pandemic. Children in rural areas risk getting left behind by not getting the quality education they deserve. Our school, the only one in the area, provides academic and life skills classes, enabling 3 girl graduates to get university scholarships and become agent of change.

description.narrative: During the Covid-19 period, many single mothers, victims of domestic violence, are struggling with the lack of resources and the basic products for their children. The pandemic lefts without a job many women and there are too few NGOs offering social services for the victims of violence. Abused women from rural areas or small cities don't go to shelters but choose simply to leave the house where they were living together with the aggressor and find another house to start over.

title.narrative: Help deprived individuals in Akkar during Ramadan

description.narrative: The deterioration of the socio-economic status in Lebanon, the skyrocketing prices and the COVID-19 have affected many families. With Ramadan coming next month, followed by Eid El Fter, the expenses will further increase. People in Akkar who were already struggling to meet their needs, do not have enough money to prepare for the holy month and buy the essential food. Help us to ensure that deprived individuals in Akkar will not be left hungry in Ramadan and will partake in the joy of Eid.

title.narrative: Help Women Access Education During Pandemic

description.narrative: The Asherah Foundation is committed to helping women around the world overcome barriers to postsecondary education. This project will financially support three women in Liberia, Burundi, and South Sudan continue their education in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic that has disproportionately impacted women and exacerbated gender inequalities. The future of higher education is constantly evolving and the Asherah Foundation is dedicated to standing by women through all these changes.

The project will fund over 1,200 treatments across all 4 states.

title.narrative: Mental Health Care for Women in India and Kenya

description.narrative: This project aims to offer psychological and social support to 31 women based in Kenya and India who currently work in our organization, Project Tres. The COVID-19 pandemic has hit them and their families hard, making it a huge struggle to continue their own development. By providing them with therapy sessions and a community garden, they will be given resources to heal and get back on their path towards independence and self-growth.

Kliptown is one of the poorest informal settlements in Soweto, South Africa, with an unemployment rate of over 70% (and even higher than this during Covid 19 Pandemic). Each One Teach One provides 3 meals a day for a number of 200 young people of Kliptown which most of them are school attenders. we provide Breakfast, lunch boxes and also lunch for the kids of Kliptown everyday.

We will work in close partnership with our network of more than 4,000 local health centers worldwide, health workers, strategic partners and others. Our focus areas include health center resilience, mental health, access to supplies and medicine, vaccine readiness and curbing the spread.

title.narrative: HELP GCS MITIGATE THE EFFECTS OF COVID 19 LOCKDOWN

description.narrative: The COVID-19 pandemic is affecting disadvantaged children in our school and orphanage, especially girls. Even before the pandemic, many families of the students in our school lived below the poverty line and struggled to survive on a daily basis. Garram Children's School offers our students an opportunity to acquire the skills and qualifications they need to obtain formal employment, especially girls. This enables them to determine their own futures, and to break the cycle of poverty.

title.narrative: Learning Resources for 125 children in Zimbabwe

description.narrative: This project will provide academic resources (50 laptops, 130 solar lights, and 250 new books) to 125 orphaned and vulnerable children at Zara's Center, an after school safe haven in Bulawayo, Zimbabwe. A year long public school shutdown due to covid-19 has exacerbated existing inequalities, making academic achievement even more elusive to at-risk children. Zara's Center will implement a comprehensive supplemental academic program to ensure long term success.

title.narrative: Covid-19 medical relief in the Peruvian Amazon

description.narrative: Peru is one of the hardest-hit countries by Covid-19, and the Peruvian Amazon region has suffered particularly harshly. Hospitals and health systems have collapsed, and rural communities have been largely abandoned to deal with the pandemic on their own. There is literally no oxygen for Covid patients dying in the lungs of the planet. We are raising funds to directly supply medications to small rural communities, and to aid civic groups providing care to the poorest citizens of Iquitos, Peru.

Despite the construction of additional classrooms, still classrooms were over-crowded. This is how SPES NOVA Junior Academy was created to help address the issue.
